description: A biomaterial contains information on the biobiomaterial that was sequenced or imaged. This includes donor, body part, and anything that comes between removing the biomaterial from a donor and the assay.
title: biomaterial_core

biomaterial_id.description: A unique ID for this biomaterial.

name.description: A short, descriptive name for the biomaterial that need not be unique.

description.description: A general description of the biomaterial.

genus_species.description: Scientific binomial name of donor species. e.g. Homo sapiens.

derived_from.description: If this biomaterial is derived from another biomaterial e.g. a tissue or donor, enter the biomaterial_id for the biomaterial this was derived from
derived_from.comment: This field is primarily required for spreadsheet based submissions

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of biomaterial-level supplementary files.

biosd_biomaterial.description: A DDBJ, NCBI, or EBI Biobiomaterial ID. Accessions must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME.

insdc_biomaterial.description: An INSDC (International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration) biomaterial accession. Can be from the DDBJ, EMBL-EBI, or NCBI. Accession must start with DRS, ERS, or SRS.
